summary: Wallachia is a historical region in modern Romania, located between the Danube River and the Carpathian Mountains. It was formed in the 14th century and was ruled by various powers, including the Ottomans. Wallachia was divided into two main areas: Muntenia and Oltenia. In the 19th century, it united with Moldavia to become the basis of the modern Romanian state. Later, Romania expanded by adding regions like Transylvania and Bukovina.
title: Wallachia
